answers.answer: Welcome to our forum. Please take time to read our Health Pages, accessible from the top right of the page. I think a great many of your questions will be answered.Yes, it is possible to have MS without it showing on an MRI, but this is a very complex issue. You need basic info at this point. I hope the neurologist you've been referred to is an MS specialist.Good luck and keep us posted.ess
When do you see the Neuro and I suggest you write down all your symptoms and take them with you to the Drs appt.. let us know how things go and what further testing you will have.take carewobblydx

question: I have had symptoms of ms for over a year but in 2 different episodes that were 5 months apart. I am weak on my left side ,have been choking when eating, having memory loss and other problems. I had an MRI and it came back negative so I have been referred to a neurologist. MS has been mentioned but can you have it with negative a MRI. I also have absent reflexes in my left arm and leg and when the doc had me stand up close my eyes and lift one foot at a time i kept swaying and falling. What does this indicate ? Are other diseases that cause these symptoms? I feel like I am going nuts. I also have diabetes and PAD and high blood pressure but all are very well controlled.
title: Negative intercranial MRI and ms
